mission.heading: Safeguarding Sri Lanka's Aquatic Wealth Through Science
mission.description: The National Aquatic Resources Research & Development Agency (NARA) is Sri Lanka's premier institute for marine and freshwater science, dedicated to safeguarding and sustainably developing the nation's aquatic wealth. We conduct cutting-edge research, guide policy on fisheries and ocean resources, and drive innovation in the Blue Economy to benefit ecosystems and communities.
mission.focusResearch: Coastal, deep sea, and inland water programmes powering national policy and the blue economy.
mission.focusCommunity: Alliances with fishing communities, academia, and defence agencies safeguard livelihoods and maritime security.
mission.briefing: Live observatories, ocean drones, and GovCERT-secured data streams coordinate a 200 NM protective radius across Sri Lanka’s sovereign waters.
